TopicDetails.title: Automated Number Plate Recognition Systems (ANPRS)

types.typeOfAction: HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant

3284105.action: HERCULE-TA-2019-04 - HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant
HERCULE-TA-2019-01 - HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant

HERCULE-TA-2019-02 - HERCULE-ER-AG HERCULE III No Indirect Costs Action Grant

TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

The purchase, maintenance and (cross-border) interconnection of automated systems for the recognition of number-plates (ANPRSs) or container codes for purposes relating to the protection of the Union’s financial interests. Requisite specialised training in the operation of such systems is included. Cross-border cooperation enabling the exchange of information to strengthen the fight against irregularities and suspected fraud will be strongly encouraged.

Expected Impact:

Strengthening and improvement of beneficiaries’ (e.g. customs, police or tax authorities’) investigative capacities to identify trucks and vehicles suspected of involvement in activities detrimental to the Union’s financial interests, as measured by the number of verifications made with (interconnected) ANPRSs, operating hours and positive identifications (‘hits’, leading to arrests and seizures), and results from the exchange of ANPRS information with competent authorities in neighbouring and cross-border regions, other Member States and non-EU countries.
TopicDetails.conditions:
1.   Eligible countries: described in section 5 of the Call document.

 

 

2.   Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in sections 4 and 5 of the Call Document.

 

Admissibility

Applications must be submitted before the call deadline.

Applications must be submitted electronically via the Participant Portal Electronic Submission System. Paper submissions are no longer accepted.

Applications (including annexes and supporting documents) must be submitted using the forms provided inside the Participant Portal Electronic Submission System.

Your application must be readable, accessible and printable and contain all the requested information, required annexes and supporting documents.

A grant will not exceed 80% of the total eligible costs. In exceptional and duly justified cases, the financial support for an action may be increased to a maximum of 90% of the eligible costs.

Eligibility

Technical assistance applications must be submitted by national or regional administrations in a participating country which promote the strengthening of action at Union level to protect the Union’s financial interests (eligible for technical assistance, training and other actions).

Applications from third countries are subject to the conditions in Article 7(2) of the Hercule III Regulation => Currently, applicants from non-EU countries cannot submit applications.

To prove eligibility, all applicants must register in the Participant Register of the Participant Portal — before the call deadline — and upload the necessary documents showing legal status and origin.

Only applications by single applicants are allowed. No consortium is allowed to apply.

The minimum threshold for the total budgeted costs of a project submitted is set at EUR 100 000. Therefore, the requested GRANT for the action must be at least EUR 80 000 (80% of EUR 100 000).

The duration of the project will not exceed 18 months following the signature of the grant agreement by both parties.

Proposal page limits and layout: No page linits.

3.   Evaluation

      3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in section 4-8 of the Call document.
      

      3.2 For submission and evaluation process, see the Call document.

 

4.   Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: described in section 3 of the Call document.

 

5.   Proposal templates and model grant agreements (MGA):

    Standard proposal template
      Guide for applicants
      Mono-beneficiary Model Grant Agreement
     

This is a call for Mono-beneficiary grants only

6.   Additional documents:

      Annual Work Programme
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
For further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals, please contact: OLAF-FMB-HERCULE-TA@ec.europa.eu 

F&T Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.


IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.


H2020 Online Manual – Please use the manual with caution and only for the Participant Portal tools guidance, i.e. Submission service and Beneficiary register, because it is H2020 specific and does not cover the Justice Programme rules. Some aspects of the Justice Programme are different from the provisions of the H2020 programme.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service, please click on the submission-button next to the type of action that corresponds to your proposal. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action and topic, as these cannot be changed in the submission system. Upon confirmation, you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Funding & Tenders Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

callDetailsJSONItem.staticAdditionalInfo:
Hercule III-funded actions aim to protect the financial interests of the European Union by preventing and combating fraud, corruption and any other illegal activities affecting the financial interests of the Union.

The Commission will encourage actions that are jointly undertaken by the Programme's beneficiaries in different Member States to provide technical assistance in order to strengthen cross-border cooperation to fight activities detrimental to the Union's financial interests, such as smuggling of tobacco, cigarettes or VAT-carousels.

Maximum project duration: 18 months

The indicative available budget for grants for this Call is EUR 9 866 200.

The grants will cover a maximum of 80% (90% in exceptional and duly justified cases ) of the eligible costs of the action.

The minimum threshold for the TOTAL budgeted costs of a project submitted is set at EUR 100 000. Therefore, the REQUESTED GRANT for the action must be at least EUR 80 000 (80% of EUR 100 000).
